code: calc_irr_carbon(   type = c("total", "soil", "biomass", "all"),   engine = "extract",   stats = "mean" )  calc_man_carbon(   type = c("total", "soil", "biomass", "all"),   engine = "extract",   stats = "mean" )  calc_vul_carbon(   type = c("total", "soil", "biomass", "all"),   engine = "extract",   stats = "mean" )

title: Calculate carbon statistics — carbon_indicators
text: type One "total", "soil", "biomass", "". Determines data layer statistics calculated. engine preferred processing functions either one "zonal", "extract" "exactextract" character. stats Function applied compute statistics polygons either one multiple inputs character. Supported statistics : "mean", "median", "sd", "min", "max", "sum" "var".

title: Carbon Layers — carbon_resources

text: https://zenodo.org/records/4091029

title: Carbon Layers — carbon_resources

title: Carbon Layers — carbon_resources
text: may required increase timeout option successfully download theses layers source location via e.g. options(timeout = 600). Irrecoverable carbon defined amount carbon, , lost today, recovered mid 21st century (within 30 years, considering publication date). Vulnerable carbon defined amount carbon lost hypothetical typical conversion event (without including information probability event actually occurring). Manageable carbon defined land areas, expect cyrosols, carbon loss driven direct land-use conversion halted climate change impacts affecting area can potentially directly mitigated adaptive management.

title: Carbon Layers — carbon_resources
text: Noon, M.L., Goldstein, ., Ledezma, J.C. et al. Mapping irrecoverable carbon Earth’s ecosystems. Nat Sustain 5, 37–46 (2022). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41893-021-00803-6

title: Calculate human footprint statistics — humanfootprint
text: Human footprint data measures pressure imposed natural environment different dimensions human actions. theoretical maximum value, representing highest level human pressure, 50. routine allows extract zonal statistics human footprint data. resource part publication Mu et al. (2022) "global record annual terrestrial Human Footprint dataset 2000 2018". calculated based 8 variables representing human pressures natural ecosystems collected yearly cadence 2000 2020 sampled 1km spatial resolution. variables used expansion built environments (expressed percentage built-areas within grid cell), population density (aggregated gridd cell), nighttime lights, crop pasture lands, roads railways (excluding trails minor roads), navigable waterways (compares waterways nighttime lights dataset). human footprint calculated based weighting scheme proposed Venter et al. (2016), assigning pixel value 0 50, 50 representing theoretical value highest human pressure.

title: Calculate human footprint statistics — humanfootprint
text: https://figshare.com/articles/figure/An_annual_global_terrestrial_Human_Footprint_dataset_from_2000_to_2018/16571064

title: Calculate human footprint statistics — humanfootprint
text: engine preferred processing functions either one "zonal", "extract" "exactextract" character. stats Function applied compute statistics polygons either one multiple inputs character. Supported statistics : "mean", "median", "sd", "min", "max", "sum" "var". years numeric vector indicating years download human footprint data, defaults 2000:2020.

title: Calculate human footprint statistics — humanfootprint
text: function returns tibble column statistic row every requested year. function returns character vector file paths.

title: Terrestrial and Aquatic Biomes — ipbes
text: Terrestrial biomes include: Tropical subtropical dry humid forests Temperate boreal forests woodlands Mediterranean forests, woodlands scrub Tundra High Mountain habitats Tropical subtropical savannas grasslands Temperate Grasslands Deserts xeric shrublands Wetlands – peatlands, mires, bogs Aquatic biomes include: Cryosphere Aquaculture areas Inland surface waters water bodies/freshwater Shelf ecosystems (neritic intertidal/littoral zone) Open ocean pelagic systems (euphotic zone)
